In some cases, necrophiliacs work in the [[funeral]] business, presumably for the facile access to [[human]] corpses.

== Legal status ==
+
NECROPHILIACS ARE SICK FUCKS
â   â
As psychological abnormalities, necrophiliac attractions and fantasies are not specifically illegal, and "necro porn" does not have the same status as [[child pornography]] (almost invariantly illegal and outrage-provoking). It would be impossible, in most cases, to infer death or nonresponsivity, with [[legal proof]], from a pornographic image. [[BDSM]] or [[sexual role-playing | role-playing]] practices that simulate nonresponsivity on the part of one person are completely legal.
  â   â
However, having sex with a dead person is outlawed in most localities (and socially accepted almost nowhere.) Drugging a living person into a nonresponsive state for sexual purposes is usually classified as [[rape]] and punished severely. If the person dies as a result of the drug, the party responsible can also be tried for murder.
  â   â
The [[United Kingdom]] outlawed [[sexual penetration]] of a corpse in the [[Sexual Offenses Act 2003]], making the act punishable by up to two years in prison. Many [[United States | U.S.]] states prohibit such acts, though often under vague terms outlawing "abuse of a corpse".
  â   â
Until [[2004]], [[California]] had laws against mutilation of corpses and [[grave robber]]y, but none specifically against sex with corpses. On [[September 10]], [[2004]], [[Governor of California | Governor]] [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] signed a bill making such acts a felony, with maximum sentence of eight years in [[prison]]. [http://www.reuters.com/newsArticle.jhtml?type=domesticNews&storyID=6208717]
